reportTitle: jelmix Blogger Template - Lighthouse Optimization Summary
summary: This document outlines the key optimizations implemented in the jelmix template, specifically designed to achieve high scores in Google Lighthouse for Performance, Accessibility, Best Practices, and SEO.

optimizations.name: No jQuery Dependency
optimizations.description: The template is built entirely with vanilla ES6+ JavaScript, eliminating the render-blocking overhead and file size of the jQuery library. This is the single most significant performance improvement over the analyzed templates.

optimizations.name: Functional Lazy Loading of Images
optimizations.description: Images are set to lazy load using the modern and efficient Intersection Observer API. This ensures that images outside the initial viewport do not impact the initial page load time, significantly improving First Contentful Paint (FCP) and Largest Contentful Paint (LCP). The implementation now correctly handles images in post cards and within the post body.

optimizations.name: Optimized CSS
optimizations.description: All CSS is contained within a single `<b:skin>` tag, which Blogger automatically optimizes and serves. While inline critical CSS is a future goal, the current monolithic structure is standard for Blogger and has been written to be as efficient as possible. CSS variables are used for fast rendering and theme switching (dark mode).

optimizations.name: Asynchronous/Deferred Scripts (by design)
optimizations.description: All custom JavaScript is placed at the end of the `<body>` tag. This ensures that script parsing and execution do not block the initial rendering of the page content.

optimizations.name: Minimalist DOM
optimizations.description: The HTML structure is clean, semantic, and avoids the deep nesting and unnecessary elements often found in other templates, leading to faster rendering by the browser.

optimizations.name: Comprehensive Structured Data
optimizations.description: Implemented JSON-LD for `WebSite`, `Article`, and `BreadcrumbList`, providing rich context to search engines and enabling eligibility for rich snippets in search results. This is a best-in-class implementation.

optimizations.name: Dynamic Meta Tags
optimizations.description: The template dynamically generates all essential meta tags, including canonical URLs, Open Graph properties for social sharing, and Twitter Cards.

optimizations.name: Robots Meta Directives
optimizations.description: Includes logic to apply `noindex,nofollow` to search pages (but not label pages), preventing low-quality pages from being indexed.

optimizations.name: Semantic HTML5
optimizations.description: Uses semantic tags like `<main>`, `<aside>`, `<header>`, `<footer>`, and `<article>`, which helps search engines understand the structure and hierarchy of the content.

optimizations.name: Semantic Markup
optimizations.description: The use of proper HTML5 tags provides a solid foundation for screen readers and other assistive technologies.

optimizations.name: Logical Heading Structure
optimizations.description: The template is designed to enforce a logical heading hierarchy (`h1` for the main title, `h2` for post titles on index pages, etc.), which is crucial for accessibility.

optimizations.name: High-Contrast Text (by default)
optimizations.description: The default color palette in the CSS variables provides strong contrast between text and background colors, meeting WCAG guidelines.

optimizations.name: Dark Mode
optimizations.description: A functional dark mode is provided, which respects user preferences and improves readability in low-light environments.
